faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreigners have full property ownership rights in Spain with minimal restrictions. No special visa is required for property purchase, though Spanish resident status offers tax advantages. British, EU, and other international nationals routinely own Spanish property. Professional legal advice ensures proper documentation and tax structuring.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, buyers typically incur: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (€1,000-2,000), land registry fees (€500-1,000), and legal fees (€2,000-4,000). Total closing costs generally range 8-12% of purchase price. Ongoing costs include property tax (0.4-1.1% annually) and community fees for apartment buildings (typically €100-200 monthly).

faqs.question: What is the rental income potential for this apartment?
faqs.answer: This 3-bedroom apartment typically achieves €800 per week during peak season (June-September) and €500-600 during shoulder months. At conservative 50% annual occupancy, this generates approximately €41,000 gross annual income, providing 11.7% gross yield on the €350,750 purchase price. Professional management companies handle bookings, cleaning, and maintenance for 20-30% commission.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca demonstrates strong investment fundamentals: +8% year-on-year appreciation, sustained international demand, year-round tourism supporting rental income, excellent climate, and established infrastructure. faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) ranges 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value, typically €800-1,500 annually for this property. Capital gains tax applies on sale (19-45% depending on holding period and residency status, with non-residents paying 19% flat). Spanish residents benefit from principal residence exemptions. Professional accountants optimize tax structuring for international ownership.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can obtain Spanish mortgages, though typically at higher rates and with larger down payments (30-40% required). Spanish banks require income verification and may require EU/residency documentation. Many British investors find it more cost-effective to use UK mortgages for Spanish property, though Spanish-sourced mortgages offer tax deduction benefits. Professional mortgage brokers can compare options.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers excellent value: groceries 20-30% cheaper than UK, dining €10-15 for quality meals, utilities €100-150 monthly, and healthcare costs minimal with Spanish national insurance. Total monthly living costs for a couple range €1,200-1,800 comfortably, 30-40% below UK equivalents. Property owners often find rental income exceeds all expenses significantly.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van België?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche International Airport is 20 minutes from this property, with direct flights to London (2 hours 15 minutes), Manchester (2 hours 30 minutes), and Birmingham (2 hours 20 minutes). faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with Mediterranean climate: summer temperatures 28-32°C (warm for swimming), winter 12-17°C (mild, rare frosts). Annual rainfall is minimal (300-400mm), concentrated in autumn/spring. This climate supports year-round tourism, maintaining strong rental demand. Property maintenance requirements are minimal due to stable weather conditions.
